name: Validation Run (5 rounds)
description: Quick 5-round validation to confirm orchestrator bug fix and escalation path. Same agents as overnight but capped at 5 rounds.

tasks.primary: Read all agent handoffs, the project TODO list (MEMORY.md), and current backlog.json. Identify what work needs doing next. Generate 3-5 new tasks in backlog.json for other agents. Prioritize: balance fixes > bug fixes > test coverage > UI polish > features > CSS polish. Write a status summary to orchestrator/analysis/producer-status.md.

Run simulations at all tiers (bare, uncommon, epic, giga). Identify the weakest archetype at each tier. Make ONE small tuning change per round (max +/-3 stat points or one constant tweak). Verify tests pass. Track win rate trajectory across rounds. Target: no archetype below 44% or above 58% at any tier.

Each round: pick ONE untested area and write 5-10 new tests for it. Focus areas in order: 1) gear variant interactions, 2) archetype matchup edge cases, 3) stamina/fatigue boundary conditions, 4) softCap behavior near knee=100, 5) melee phase resolution edge cases. Run full suite to verify no regressions. Also fix any test assertions broken by balance changes from other agents.

Each round: pick ONE UI element and improve its visual design. Focus areas in order: 1) combat result screens (damage numbers, animations), 2) responsive breakpoints, 3) melee transition polish, 4) winner banner refinement, 5) accessibility improvements. Make small, incremental improvements. Coordinate with ui-dev agent for JSX-side changes.

Each round: review changes made by other agents this session. Read their handoffs and modified files. Check for: type safety issues, hardcoded magic numbers, broken patterns, missing error handling, UI/engine coupling violations. Write review report to orchestrator/analysis/review-round-N.md. Keep CLAUDE.md updated with correct test counts and balance state. If you find issues, note them in your handoff notes-for-others so the relevant agent can fix them next round.

Each round: pick ONE UI improvement task. Priority order: 1) Migrate inline styles to CSS classes created by the polish agent (59 inline styles identified, class replacements ready in App.css), 2) Add rarity class to gear-item divs in LoadoutScreen for rarity-colored borders, 3) Improve combat result readability (who won, by how much, why), 4) Polish state transitions between screens, 5) Improve archetype/stat display clarity for new players. Run tests before handoff. Coordinate with polish agent on CSS class names.

Each round: analyze the current game experience and write a design report. Focus areas in order: 1) Is every archetype interesting to play (not just balanced, but FUN)? 2) Are choices meaningful in each phase (speed, attack, gear variant)? 3) Does the AI provide a satisfying opponent at each difficulty? 4) Is combat feedback clear enough for new players? 5) What one change would most improve the player experience? Write proposals to orchestrator/analysis/design-round-N.md with clear specs the other agents can implement. Do NOT edit source files â€” you propose, others implement.
